headline.main: Dangerous Dietary Supplements Return to Store Shelves

docs.abstract: The Food and Drug Administration frequently recalls dietary supplements that are found to contain banned substances, but many of these products are back on the market months later, a new study found.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration frequently recalls dietary supplements that are found to contain banned substances, but many of these products are back on the market months later, a new study found.

headline.main: A Weight Loss Belief Is Tested
headline.print_headline: Regimens: A Weight Loss Belief Is Tested

docs.abstract: A new randomized trial has found no long-term difference in weight regain among people who lost the pounds slowly and those who did so quickly.
docs.snippet: A new randomized trial has found no long-term difference in weight regain among people who lost the pounds slowly and those who did so quickly.

headline.main: Beijing Donates $6 Million for Food Aid in Ebola Fight

docs.abstract: China, a leading trading partner to many African countries, has been urged to take a more active role in the Ebola fight.
docs.snippet: China, a leading trading partner to many African countries, has been urged to take a more active role in the Ebola fight.

docs.lead_paragraph: SHV, a family-owned Dutch investment firm, has reached a conditional agreement to buy animal feed and nutrition company Nutreco for 2.7 billion euros (2.13 billion pounds), expanding into food-related businesses.

headline.main: Dutch Investment Firm SHV Bids $3.4 Billion for Nutreco
headline.print_headline: Dutch Investment Firm SHV Bids $3.4 Billion for Nutreco

docs.snippet: SHV, a family-owned Dutch investment firm, has reached a conditional agreement to buy animal feed and nutrition company Nutreco for 2.7 billion euros (2.13 billion pounds), expanding into food-related businesses.

docs.lead_paragraph: French foods group Danone SA said on Sunday it was not conducting a strategic review of assets and had not decided on any priority in terms of possible external growth possibilities.

headline.main: Danone Says Board Hadn't Discussed Mead Johnson and Not Carrying Out Review
headline.print_headline: Danone Says Board Hadn't Discussed Mead Johnson and Not Carrying Out Review

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N.'s World Food Program on Saturday delivered emergency food rations to 265,000 people, many of them quarantined in Sierra Leone, to help fight the spread of Ebola.

headline.main: Food Deliveries in Sierra Leone to Fight Ebola
headline.print_headline: Food Deliveries in Sierra Leone to Fight Ebola

docs.lead_paragraph: Senegal’s achievement came as the virus rampaged in neighboring countries and contagion alarm continued to mount.

headline.main: In Conspicuous Success, Senegal Is Declared Ebola-Free

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE

docs.lead_paragraph: German healthcare group Fresenius as well as buyout groups PAI and Permira are exploring an acquisition of the medical nutrition business of Danone after efforts of U.S. drugmaker Hospira to buy the unit failed, people familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: Exclusive: Fresenius, Buyout Groups Eye Danone Medical Nutrition Unit-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Fresenius, Buyout Groups Eye Danone Medical Nutrition Unit-Sources

docs.snippet: German healthcare group Fresenius as well as buyout groups PAI and Permira are exploring an acquisition of the medical nutrition business of Danone after efforts of U.S. drugmaker Hospira to buy the unit failed, people familiar with the matter said.
